IterPlier Class Reference

Runs plier() interatively using the "best" features in each iteration, currently the features most correlated with the initial target signal estimates. More...

Static Public Attributes

static const int noData = -10000

Detailed Description

Runs plier() interatively using the "best" features in each iteration, currently the features most correlated with the initial target signal estimates.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

IterPlier::IterPlier (  ) 

Constructor.

Create our own local memory caches.

Parameters:
maxFeature - Maximum initial number of features, if more features are needed internal buffers will automatically be enlarged.
maxChip - Maximum initial number of chips, if more chips are needed internal buffers will automatically be enlarged.

Definition at line 114 of file IterPlier.cpp.

Referenced by QuantIterPlier::computeEstimate().

long IterPlier::runCorrIterPlier ( caffyplier &  plier,
int  atomCount,
int  chipCount,
double **  pm,
double **  mm,
double *  targetResponse,
double *  featureResponse,
double **  residuals,
int *  atomUsed,
int  iterCount,
int *  iterFeature 
)

Iteratively call plier decreasing the number of features by selecting those that are most correlated with the target response from the previous iteration.

Parameters:
plier - plier object with parameters already set.
atomCount - Number of atoms. Indicates feature pairs, length of featureRespons, and number columns in pm & mm matrices.
chipCount - Number of experiments. Indicates the hybridizations, length of targetResponse and number of rows in pm & mm matrices.
pm - Matrix of perfect match feature intensities (chipCount rows and atomCount cols);
mm - Matrix of background feature intensities (chipCount rows and atomCount cols);
targetResponse - Where signal estimates will be filled in.
featureResponse - Where feature effects will be filled in.
residuals - Residuals left after fitting.
atomUsed - Array of length atomCount indicating features used for final fit.
iterCount - Number of additional iterations of plier to do.
iterFeature - Number of features each iteration after initial plier call. e.g iterCount = 2, and iterFeature = 22,11
Returns:
long plier errorcode.
